abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Support to Basic
            Education Project for Congo, Republic of is to improve
            efficiency, quality and equity in the provision of basic
            education in the territory of the Recipient with a view to
            achieving universal quality primary education by 2015. Since
            July 2011, Ministry of Primary and Secondary Education in
            charge of Literacy (MEPSA) has taken a number of actions
            that will create a stronger enabling environment for the
            project to proceed, notably: (i) the strengthening of the
            procurement capacity and the recruitment of an internal
            auditor, (ii) retrofitting the sector indicators with a
            consistent base of population projection, (iii) decision to
            continue with the United Nations Development Program (UNDP)
            for the execution of the 2nd phase of the school
            infrastructure and school-based management program, and (iv)
            partnership with Program on the Analysis of Education
            Systems (PASEC) for learning assessment. In addition MEPSA
            has prepared an implementation plan acceptable to the Bank
            to complete the project. The extension is the first and last
            extension of the additional financing to the original
            project. This requires an exception to OP/BP 13.20 which
            states that additional financing operations must be
            completed within three years of the closing date of the
            original loan that is in effect when the additional loan is
            approved. An exception was requested and approved by Bank management.
